alert.note: Alert for Mountains Of San Benito County And Interior Monterey County Including Pinnacles National Park; Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued December 07 at 4:23AM PST until December 08 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM PST FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 32 will result in frost formation. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 possible. * WHERE...Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco, and Lake San Antonio and Mountains of San Benito and Interior Monterey County including Pinnacles National Park. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from midnight tonight to 9 AM PST Friday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Mountains Of San Benito County And Interior Monterey County Including Pinnacles National Park; Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio
